songTitle: Kỳ đà là cha cắc ké

phrases.text: Kỳ Đà là cha Cắc Ké

culturalContext.description: Traditional Vietnamese children's song about reptile family relationships
facts: Kỳ Đà refers to monitor lizards or iguanas found in Vietnam
This is a humorous, circular family riddle popular with children

phrases.text: Cắc Ké là mẹ Kỳ Nhông

culturalContext.description: Continues the circular family logic with mother-child relationship
facts: Cắc Ké is onomatopoeia for gecko's clicking sound
Kỳ Nhông refers to chameleons in Vietnamese folklore
culturalContext.musicalContext: Parallel melodic structure to first phrase

phrases.text: Kỳ Nhông là ông Kỳ Đà Kỳ
phrases.english: Chameleon is grandfather of Lizard, hey!

culturalContext.description: Completes the impossible circular family tree with exclamatory ending
facts: The circular logic (A is parent of B, B of C, C of A) teaches children about logical paradoxes
Final 'Kỳ' is an exclamatory particle emphasizing the absurdity
culturalContext.musicalContext: Concludes with emphatic ending 'Kỳ' creating closure
